passgenau: perfect fit recommendation for a Connector!
section1Absatz1: The connection to Data Spaces poses a major challenge, especially for smaller organizations. The necessary IT know-how is often not available or the time and financial barriers are too high.
section1Absatz2: The MDSxNRW portal is used to support participation in the Mobility Data Space and helps with the selection and provision of an individually suitable connector.
section2Absatz1: Based on your information, our recommendation engine searches for the connector that best suits your company and your requirements. All you have to do is answer a few questions about your company and we will look for the right connectors.
section2Absatz2: Our recommendation engine calculates a score from the superimposition of your company-specific information and the information from the connector provider, which reflects how well the specifications overlap. You can see the calculation of the score and the relevant properties later.

datenschutz1: As part of the use of this website, your personal data will be processed by us as the person responsible for data processing and stored for the period necessary to fulfill the specified purposes and legal obligations. In the following we will inform you about what data is involved, how it is processed and what rights you are entitled to in this regard. According to Article 4 No.1 of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), personal data is any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person.
datenschutzList2: Name and contact details of the person responsible for processing and the company data protection officer

datenschutzList8: Updating and changing this data protection information
datenschutzList1Content: This data protection information applies to data processing on all project websites of the project, as well as all services offered in connection with the project as a web service or as a mobile app (for better readability hereinafter: website), provided that reference is made to this data protection information.
datenschutzList2Content1: Responsible within the meaning of Art. 4 No. 7 GDPR:
datenschutzList2Content2: Fraunhofer Society for the Promotion of Applied Research e.V.
datenschutzList2Content3: for Fraunhofer Institute for Software and Systems Engineering ISST Fraunhofer ISST
datenschutzList2Content4: hereinafter referred to as Fraunhofer ISST
datenschutzList2Content5: The data protection officer at Fraunhofer can be contacted at the above address in Munich, attn: data protection officer or at
datenschutzList2Content6: reachable. You can contact our data protection officer directly at any time with questions about data protection law or your rights as a data subject.
datenschutzList3Content2: You can access our website without having to reveal any information about your identity. The browser used on your end device only automatically sends information to our website server (e.g. browser type and version, date and time of access) to enable the website to establish a connection. This also includes the IP address of your requesting end device. This is temporarily stored in a so-called log file and deleted after 30 days at the latest. The IP address is processed for technical and administrative purposes of connection establishment and stability in order to ensure the security and functionality of our website and to be able to trace any illegal attacks on it if necessary. The legal basis for processing the IP address is Article 6 Paragraph 1 Sentence 1 lit. f GDPR. Our legitimate interest follows from the security interest mentioned and the need for trouble-free provision of our website. We cannot draw any direct conclusions about your identity from the processing of the IP address and other information in the log file. In addition, we use cookies when you visit our website. You will find more detailed explanations on this below in this data protection information.
datenschutzList4Content1: If we pass on personal data that we collect via the website to processors, we will inform you of this in this data protection information for the respective data processing operation, naming the specific recipient. Otherwise, we only pass on your personal data if you have given your express consent to this in accordance with Article 6 Paragraph 1 Clause 1 Letter a GDPR; This is necessary in accordance with Art. 6 (1) sentence 1 lit. b GDPR for the fulfillment of a contract with you (e.g. when passing on to shipping companies for the purpose of delivering the goods you have ordered or when passing on payment data to payment service providers or credit institutions, to carry out a payment transaction); there is a legal obligation for the transfer according to Article 6 Paragraph 1 Clause 1 Letter c GDPR. The data passed on may only be used by the recipients for the stated purposes.
datenschutzList5Content1: We use cookies on our site. These are small files that your browser creates automatically and that are stored on your end device (laptop, tablet, smartphone, etc.) when you visit our site. Cookies do not damage your end device and do not contain viruses, Trojans or other malware. Information is stored in the cookie that arises in connection with the specific end device used. However, this does not mean that we are immediately informed of your identity. On the one hand, the use of cookies serves to make the use of our offer more pleasant for you. For example, we use so-called session cookies to enable session control or to save form entries or shopping carts during the session. Session cookies are deleted at the latest when you close your web browser. The data processed by cookies are required for the stated purposes to protect our legitimate interests and those of third parties in accordance with Article 6 Paragraph 1 Sentence 1 lit. f GDPR. Most browsers accept cookies automatically. However, you can configure your browser in such a way that no cookies are stored on your computer or that a message always appears before a new cookie is created. However, the complete deactivation of cookies can mean that you cannot use all functions of our website.
datenschutzList6Content2: pursuant to Art. 7 Para. 3 GDPR, to revoke your consent once given to us at any time. As a result, we are no longer allowed to continue the data processing based on this consent for the future;
datenschutzList6Content3: to request information about your personal data processed by us in accordance with Art. 15 GDPR. In particular, you can obtain information about the processing purposes, the category of personal data, the categories of recipients to whom your data was or will be disclosed, the planned storage period, the existence of a right to correction, deletion, restriction of processing or objection, the existence of a Right to complain, the origin of your data, if not collected from us, and the existence of automated decision-making including profiling and, if necessary, meaningful information about their details;
datenschutzList6Content4: in accordance with Art. 16 GDPR, to immediately request the correction of incorrect or incomplete personal data stored by us;
datenschutzList6Content5: According to Art. 17 GDPR, to request the deletion of your personal data stored by us, unless the processing is necessary to exercise the right to freedom of expression and information, to fulfill a legal obligation, for reasons of public interest or to assert, exercise or defend legal claims is required;
datenschutzList6Content6: pursuant to Art. 18 GDPR to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data if you dispute the accuracy of the data, the processing is unlawful, but you refuse to delete it and we no longer need the data, but you use them to assert, exercise or defense of legal claims or you have objected to the processing pursuant to Art. 21 GDPR;
datenschutzList6Content7: in accordance with Art. 20 GDPR, to receive your personal data that you have provided to us in a structured, common and machine-readable format or to request transmission to another person responsible and
datenschutzList6Content8: to complain to a supervisory authority in accordance with Art. 77 GDPR. As a rule, you can contact the supervisory authority of your usual place of residence or work or our company headquarters.
datenschutzList6Content9: Information about your right of objection according to Art. 21 GDPR
datenschutzList6Content10: You have the right, for reasons that arise from your particular situation, at any time against the processing of personal data concerning you, which is based on Article 6 Paragraph 1 Letter e GDPR (data processing in the public interest) and Article 6 Paragraph 1 Letter f GDPR ( Data processing on the basis of a balance of interests) takes place to object; this also applies to profiling based on this provision under Article 4 No. 4 GDPR. If you file an objection, we will no longer process your personal data unless we can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds for processing that outweigh your interests, rights and freedoms, or the processing serves to assert, exercise or defend legal claims. If you object to the processing of data for direct marketing purposes, we will stop processing immediately. In this case, it is not necessary to state a special situation. This also applies to profiling insofar as it is associated with such direct advertising. If you would like to make use of your right of objection, an e-mail to is sufficient
datenschutzList7Content1: All data you personally transmit is encrypted using the generally accepted and secure standard TLS (Transport Layer Security). TLS is a secure and proven standard that is also used in online banking, for example. You can recognize a secure TLS connection by the appended s to http (i.e. https://..) in the address bar of your browser or by the lock symbol at the bottom of your browser. We also use appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your data against accidental or intentional manipulation, partial or complete loss, destruction or against unauthorized access by third parties. Our security measures are continuously improved in line with technological developments.
datenschutzList8Content1: Due to the further development of our website and offers or due to changed legal or official requirements, it may become necessary to change this data protection information. You can access and print out the current data protection information from the website at any time.
kontaktFragen: If you have any questions or comments, please feel free to contact us!
infoSection11: The targeted use of data can result in innovative and sustainable products and services. However, individual actors rarely have enough data for innovative business cases to monetize data or save costs. In the respective
infoSection13: partners therefore exchange information and share their data in order to create the required data basis.
infoSection14: In order for participants within these ecosystems to have a safe and
infoSection16: more and more data room initiatives are being formed. The person responsible for the mobility domain
infoSection17: enables innovative and sustainable use cases in the mobility sector. The
infoSection19: this involves connecting new participants to the Mobility Data Space in order to make mobility more environmentally friendly, safer, more user-friendly and fair.
infoSection110: MDSxNRW was created for this purpose. MDSxNRW gives potential participants a tailor-made connector recommendation in order to participate in the Mobility Data Space and help shape the mobility of tomorrow.
infoSection22: Data is one of the most important resources of our time. These form the basis for innovative products, services and business models. In particular, artificial intelligence and statistical forecasts based on big data require large amounts of high-quality data.
infoSection23: This need for data can often not be covered by a company itself. For this reason, various actors in this environment are joining forces and forming a data ecosystem. Here data are interchangeable
infoSection31: Confident data exchange across company boundaries
infoSection32: Participants in a data ecosystem need to ensure that the data they share is used the way they want it to be used and that the data offered meets their quality requirements. To achieve this, the participants in the ecosystem come together and set up a data room.
infoSection33: In this context, a data room describes an infrastructure that enables transactions between different parties of a data ecosystem based on the governance framework of that data room.
infoSection34: A key function of the data room is maintaining data sovereignty. The data provider in a data room retains complete control over his data - even if it has been used by third parties.
infoSection35: You can find more information on data rooms and data sovereignty
infoSection42: Connectors represent the gateway to a data room. These offer the possibility of securely and confidently sharing data in a data room.
infoSection43: Via a local installation, the connectors act as endpoints for peer-2-peer communication between data provider and data consumer. In addition, the connectors offer the possibility of assigning and tracking terms of use for the data, integrating services and verifying the identity of the data room participants.
infoSection44: These terms of use are exchanged with the data and represent rules and conditions under which the data provided may be used. For example, the user group can be restricted or use can only be permitted for a certain period of time.
infoSection54: The Mobility Data Space is the data sharing community for everyone who wants to make mobility more environmentally friendly, safer, more user-friendly and fair. The Mobility Data Space 2021 was initiated as one of the 18 flagship projects of the federal government's digital strategy.
infoSection55: The Mobility Data Space (MDS) brings companies, organizations and institutions together: those who want to monetize their data treasures or save costs and those who need data for innovative mobility solutions.
infoSection56: The aim is to create a cross-company data economy in order to implement and further develop innovative, environmentally friendly and user-friendly mobility concepts. More on this
infoSection61: In the Mobility Data Space you can now find
infoSection63: from the fields of mobility, public administration and transport, mobile communications, energy and research.
infoSection64: The implementation of a wide variety of business cases has already begun in order to make mobility more digital and sustainable. A wide variety of use cases are already being implemented. Topics such as intermodal travel, local storm forecasts, and AI-based optimization for mobility offers are all topics that are made possible by the Mobility Data Space.
infoSection65: You can find more business cases of the MDS
infoSection72: The success of a data room depends on the number and diversity of its participants.
infoSection73: A recurring process is the connection of new participants to a data room who want to bring data into the data room or use available data for their own added value. The central software component here is the connector.
infoSection74: Potential data room participants can have very different organizational and technical requirements. Many different companies are represented, from private mobility service providers to public open data providers or municipal administration to independent app developers. In addition, there are various connector solutions.
infoSection75: It is a major challenge for potential data room participants to identify and set up the connector required for their needs.
infoSection76: The selection of the right connector and its deployment options are therefore crucial.
aboutSection22: With MDSxNRW, the first portal is created for easy selection of a suitable connector and for uncomplicated connection to the Mobility Data Space. The project has been carried out by the Fraunhofer Institute for Software and System Technology ISST since August 2022 and is funded by the state government of North Rhine-Westphalia for a period of 36 months.
aboutSection31: The Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft is a pioneer for innovative developments and scientific excellence in the data economy. In 2015, Fraunhofer laid the foundation for the development of the International Data Spaces. Since then, Fraunhofer has been specifying and developing the technology together with the IDS community. As a research institution, Fraunhofer takes an unbiased and neutral stance to advocate for data sovereignty.
aboutSection41: Sustainable, digital and simple mobility is becoming increasingly important for many people. As the most populous federal state with 4.8 million
aboutSection45: in Germany, North Rhine-Westphalia has a special interest in promoting and using innovative mobility solutions. MDSxNRW is part of this digitization offensive.
aboutSection52: The transparency of our recommendation engine is of particular importance. The connector recommendation is therefore designed to be as comprehensible as possible and developed together with our partners. The connector score shows which connector suits your company and how well. It is also possible to understand how the score is calculated and which characteristics are decisive in the calculation.
aboutSection62: You decide what happens to your data. Sharing data is more important than ever for the development of innovative business models. However, as soon as one's own treasure trove of data leaves the company's borders, security concerns arise. A central promise of data rooms is therefore data sovereignty. In this way, you can be sure at all times that your data is being used as you intended – even outside your company boundaries.
stepper12: Please enter general information about your company in the free text fields. These serve to clearly allocate your company.
stepper19: Please enter information about the contact person in the free text fields.
stepper113: Would you like to address further data spaces in the future?
stepper114: You only need one connector at your company to address other data spaces. If other domains besides mobility (e.g. automotive, healthcare, energy, etc.) are relevant to you, we recommend ticking this box.
stepper2: Please enter information below that will help to categorize your company.
checkBoxOne2: Please enter the size of your company according to the number of employees and turnover: Start-Up: (young) small company with dynamic growth. Micro-enterprises: <10 employees, <2 million € turnover. Small company: <11-49 employees, <€10m turnover. Medium-sized company: <50-249 employees, <€50 million turnover. Large company: >249 employees, >€50 million turnover.
checkBoxTwo2: Please indicate how many IT experts you employ.
checkBoxThree2: Please submit a self-assessment of the existing IT know-how in your company. Low: No own software development, IT administration, use of Office and other standard software. Medium: In some cases, software to support the business model is developed and used in-house. However, the core of the business model does not lie in software development. High: IT specialists with extensive experience in software development and IT project management (databases, programming, cloud, ...). IT development is an integral part of the business model.
checkBoxFive2: Please indicate which role you would like to play in the Data Space.
checkBoxFive6: Service Provider (Provision of services in the MDS)
checkBoxSix2: How is the data you want to share or use connected or available?
checkBoxSix7: Real Time via Message Bus (e.g. Kafka, RabbitMQ)
checkBoxSeven2: Which data usage conditions do you need? Standard terms of use: for example 'Restrict data use to certain locations', 'Restrict data use to certain connectors', 'Data user may only forward encrypted data'. For complete terms of use, see: Appendix A.1 in Usage Control in the International Data Spaces (https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5675884) Special terms of use: Self-created terms of use that go beyond the given standard terms.
checkBoxEight2: How should the connector be used? CaaS: Connector-as-a-Service, Of-the-Shelf-Solution. Similar to software, the connector is offered to you as a complete software package (Software-as-a-Service). PaaS: Platform as a Service. The connector is an additional service as part of a platform service on which you may already be storing data in the cloud. Self-service: You develop a connector yourself and tailor it to your requirements.
